meanings.definition: In a manner that is extremely loud or overwhelming in volume.
meanings.sent2: The music at the concert was deafeningly loud.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed deafeningly when it saw a mouse.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the library was broken by a deafeningly loud sneeze.
meanings.sent5: The thunder roared deafeningly, shaking the windows.

meanings.definition: To an extent that causes a person to become deaf or lose hearing.
meanings.sent1: The explosion deafeningly startled the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The constant exposure to loud noises can deafeningly harm your ears.
meanings.sent3: The joke made everyone laugh so hard that they were deafeningly unable to hear the next one.
meanings.sent4: The news of the victory deafeningly echoed through the stadium.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock rang deafeningly, waking up the entire household.
